name: audio demonstrations: opycay 1.5 Digital Audio Degeneration Unit
description: Documents the processed sounds created using Eric Lunde's opycay DADU boxes, constructed by Mr. Lunde (see photo endorsement by Jeph jerman)

name: map_hazard
description: 8 tracks of unadultered electronics

name: Muder Langage & You Muder God Hard-Bound w/ sandpaper
description:
limited edition compilation of enthusiasts from around the world: GRUNT, Karl J. Paloucek, AMK, Vertonen, Bryce Beverlin ll, Jeph Jerman, Kommisar Hjuler, Miguel A. Garcia, MINDVOID, Eric Lunde.
this one's the hand-bound with heavy book board, covered in 150 grit aluminum sandpaper.

name: Muder Langage & You Muder God Hard-Bound
description:
limited edition compilation of enthusiasts from around the world: GRUNT, Karl J. Paloucek, AMK, Vertonen, Bryce Beverlin ll, Jeph Jerman, Kommisar Hjuler, Miguel A. Garcia, MINDVOID, Eric Lunde.
this one's the hand-bound in hard book board stock with rubber stamp.

name: Muder Langage & You Muder God-chap book
description:
limited edition compilation of enthusiasts from around the world: GRUNT, Karl J. Paloucek, AMK, Vertonen, Bryce Beverlin ll, Jeph Jerman, Kommisar Hjuler, Miguel A. Garcia, MINDVOID, Eric Lunde.
this one's the cheap chapbook edition.

name: K.
description: The first release by Mr. Paloucek in many years, this stunningly produced disc features compositions that are elaborate, atmospheric, and intense. Consider it “automatic music” in some ways, a music that emerges and inhabits from the interaction of piano, metal percussion, sewing machines, and chimes. Having co-founded the early Milwaukee Industrial unit Shrilltower, Mr. Paloucek has performed and collaborated with many artists over the years including Eric Lunde, Fuckface, Boy Dirt Car, Impact Test. This is tmw040, CD digipack.

name: FaustNotFaust
description:
Limited edition CD/DVDr set.
Its f**king opera. NOISE infused opera. 
Initiated by the earlier Mimefistofele cd, FaustNotFaust is a realization and exploration of the Faust Myth. Utilizing a variety of source material, FaustNotFaust stages the characters in the Space-time of noise and tape degeneration, each echoing or echoed by the recording of the other. FaustNotFaust Is being presented As a limited edition CD/DVDr Set. The Cd presents the primary “noise opera”, with audio from the live performance presented on the DVDr as well as tape outtakes used in that performance. the DVDr features the video realization as well as a video document of the live performance.

name: Particulates 0-60
description:
1 CD in wallet
Sure, you can do electronic work, but what does it take to restrain oneself to specific (albeit flexible) time parameters?  These are 61 one minute (give or take a few seconds) of pure electronic “compositions” that vary in instrumentation between analog and digital, midi and CV. Some consider the instrument singularly (Archer’s MK-1 analog drum machine, Dwarfcraft’s analog “Thumping Double Squaresnakes”, Roland Sh-101) or as an ensemble with other components (Roland MC-303, Moog “slimPhatty”, etc.). 
Produced and Recorded by Not Eric Lunde (pat. pend. 2012), recording under the pro-electronic label “h_ngt_n_”™, so as to distinguish this one from Eric Lunde®.

name: Localized Noise Induced Transitions: The Athens Survey
description:
4 disc set, 3 cdr, 1 dvdr, in handprinted canvas bag, with book and 1 signed “Polaroid” (either: Polaroid 300, Polaroid 600, or Impossible Project PX-70)
Complete document of a week-long “recording field” audio project conducted for the Athens Institute for Contemporary Art (Athica) in Athens, GA, USA in March of 2011. This is the more definitive “disc” edition, a follow-up of the 3 cassette edition released by Psych-KG last year.
3 discs of noise-induced transitions, recording field documents, and live performance. The DVDr contains footage of said actions with a final presentation.
Limited to an edition of 50, it is available now.

name: animal mineral self mirror
description:
A CIP release. a document regarding isolation and integration, history and existence. "Studio" recordings with field recordings. Here's what Mr. Blake Edwards of Vertonen/CIP sez:
I first heard Lunde’s work in perhaps 1991; I was a DJ at KUCR at the University of California, doing a program that danced between punk and experimental music. I had heard of Hands To, and when I saw the Hands To / Eric Lunde split in the new bin, I gave it a whirl. As others have rightfully said before, when Lunde’s voice comes in--"your unguarded breath" it was a moment of commanding, spine tingling confusion. His work reminds me of Z'EV's uns project in how he permutates language and utilizes his "reduplicative strategies" to simultaneously bury and uncover audio. This disc is, for these ears, "classic" Lunde; tape cassette manipulation, modulation, and endless reduplications and permutations. If you like Lunde, this will be a welcome chapter in his ongoing audio explorations. If you aren't familiar with Lunde, I'd say imagine audio that has spices of Chop Shop, EVP, and John Duncan mixed into a batter of barren lands and be prepared to go on a rather unusual, and unequivocally individual, journey.
This is just the CD. Artist editions, and there are few of them, might be available through http://cipsite.net/

name: A World of Hurt in the Kingdom of g*d
description:
CD just released by Heart and Crossbone Records. Sort of an intimate tour diary of that Hell we call "life" as ruled by that mythical abstraction alluded to in the title. Here, let H&C explain it:
"A World Of Hurt In The Kingdom Of God" derives its name from a series of 2-ply plastic engravings Lunde did in 2004, The original title being "A World of Hurt in the Kingdom of Gosh". It is primarily a product of the concerns Lunde still have (and expressed in his book "Prison Sex", from which the majority of the text on this album is taken from) with the latent cruelty of humans in regards to their alleged relationship with a fabricated supernatural being and how is it that religious people have to prove nothing, but the atheist ones have to prove everything.

name: Mimefistofele
description:
Now available! Eric Lunde's interpretation of Bioto's classic opera! 60 minutes of reduplicated and degenerated audio arranged to follow the first act....
CD, jewel case, 4 color graphics

name: technot
description: Not really techno, but a collection of various audio excursions into the domain, utilizing then-current MIDI hardware of the nineties. Never before released, the approach isn't dance oriented pop but struggling loops and layered signals.

name: AN EXTREMELY LOUD SILENCE:AUDIO RENDITIONS OF BECKETT'S DRAMAS
description:
Like the title suggests, three of Samuel Beckett's Dramas are interpreted by Peter J. Woods ("A Piece of Monologue"), Bryce Beverlin ll ("Cascando"),  and Eric Lunde ("That Time").
what does Vital Weekly say?
Of course you should read the complete entry on Wikipedia on Samuel Beckett, but I quote the beginning: “Samuel Barclay Beckett (13 April 1906 – 22 December 1989) was an Irish avant-garde writer, dramatist and poet, writing in English and French. Beckett’s work offers a bleak outlook on human culture and both formally and philosophically became increasingly minimalist in his later career.” I must admit I never read much of his work, but here’s three artists who probably read lots of Beckett. Its the for me unknown Bryce Beverlin II, the well-known Eric Lunde and Peter J. Woods, whose LP was reviewed here two week ago. Each has a long piece inspired by the dramas written by Beckett. In Wood’s piece things start with talking for quite some time, and after a while injected by loud bursts of noise, which towards the end get longer and longer. The text is not always clear to hear. Lunde used three cassette players for his piece, which has Lunde stamped all over it. Largely, or more accurate, all spoken word in Lunde’s clear voice, but with treatments made with his cassettes, eroding the speech effectively. Occasional silence separates the various texts. Extremely loud is the keyword for the final piece, by Bryce Beverlin II, who also speaks his text in the middle of a noise racket of distortion and feedback, also with occasional silence. Its the least convincing piece in my opinion, but it takes minimalism probably to another level. Quite an interesting release, which prompts the listener to listen, but probably also to read more, which is always good, I think. (FdW)

artists.name: Bryce Beverlin ll/ Peter J. Woods/ Eric Lunde

name: I am a Copy of a Copy of a Strange Loop
description:
A book of theory. it combines the earlier text "Reduplicative Strategies" with more recent essays about time, reduplication, self and mind. 
A re-consideration of Douglas R. Hofstadter's theories of the neuro-cognitive basis of the self as expressed in "I Am A Strange Loop" expanding on his notion that we are all copy machines and exploring the idea further by asking the question "what if we are not only copy machines but what if everything we have come to know and express is merely copies of copies? What if the self is merely a copy of a copy?"
going out on a limb here....

name: candyhole
description:
A Freak Animal release from 2010. Power electronics, field recordings, rants, raves, sexual indulgences and nerve noise.
CD.

name: Music is Meat combo
description:
Book: 200 odd pages of fictional memoir, theory, noise, comix, graphics.
CD: 60 odd minutes of noise, "rock" and memoir.
dirttrap is a fictional industrial band, based on Mr. Lunde's experience of the "scene" in the 1980's (oh, how little has changed!). This would be their/his story told through 3 different Erics. Vital Weekly says:
"Its perhaps also not a book to read back to back. Its a novel about about an obscure industrial band being filmed for a documentary. But the singer is dead and the band re-enacted by others, and then becomes popular than the original. Maybe its about the fact that noise music is now more popular than it was when Lunde started, in the early 80s. The book tells the story in a rather abstract way, cut along with drawings from the story board and thoughts about what noise is. In some ways its probably a not very accurate autobiography, but no doubt it carries a lot of personal memories from Lunde from the old days. A funny read, especially if that 'old' noise scene is part of your own experience. To listen to the 'soundtrack' (not my parentheses) at the same time is not easy, as it contains a lot of spoken word pieces (from the book?), and bits of audio. The whole package, book and CD, however is unmistakably 'noisy': a bombardment of text and sound, both in print and on the CD, creating a beautiful and disturbed image. Excellent stuff."

name: Localized Noise-Induced Transitions + LRAD: Compostions for the Long Range Acoustical Device
description:
Both CDS at once! 2x the "pleasure"!

Localized Noise-Induced Transitions:

1/2 science experiment, 1/4 military maneuver, 1/4 found, LN-IT is a selection of field recordings made with the Short-Range Acoustic Device developed by Mr. Lunde. Vital weekly said of this:
"Mysterious, intense, ambient and at the same time industrial, this is some great stuff."
Hand Printed digipak cover.

LRAD: Compostions for the Long Range Acoustical Device

Audio Composed for the Long Range Acoustical Device. Hand-printed digipak cover. Vital Weekly said:
"The trademark sound of Lunde - the degeneration of sound - is clearly present in these recordings. A high pitched sound, distorted radio noise like sounds, and sounding like tape being fed through the heads of a machine, at some higher speed than is usual. Of these three this is my least favorite: perhaps because its too noisy and perhaps too much in common Lunde territory."
Too noisy? You be the judge....

name: Colorado Terrain Investigation/ Aztalan/Camp Douglas Quadrangle
description: Once again, another faithful re-release by our friends at Freak Animal Records in Finland. Originally released by RRRecords between 1985-1988, this CD combines two classics of industrial/noise field recordings. Named for the two sites they were conducted at (or alluded to in the case of CDQ).

name: XCHDX/TAPE DEATH CUT
description: The Freak Animal (Finland) re-release of 2 Lunde LP' from the 80's: Xchdx On the Terrain of Prophecy first released by Alamut Records in 1989, and Tape Death Cut, released by Complacency Records also in 1989.  These recordings are considered by many as definitive works of industrial/noise of the period. See for yourself....

name: PACKAGE JOB!
description:
5 CDRs, 3 DVDrs for a really low price:

Formerly Blood, Now Mourning
XCHDX:The Unexplored Territory CDr and DVDr set
Suites for Analog Recorders
Original Source Recordings
Reduplicative Strategies CDr and DVDr set

gotta make some room here!

name: Trait: Inspirationals
description: Back in 1988 Arbeit Group label released obscure industrial-noise release by project called TRAIT. A-side of the tape includes several different arrangement for inspiration in battle. B-side included several of those arrangements combined together for temporary unified action. 45 minutes of most primitive analogue destruction, leaving no place for easylistening or relaxing moments. Even with the atmopheric and dark moment, sound is extremely decayed and coarse sound of tape loops, manipulation and electronics which transforms it to difficult industrial-noise. Years after the original release, personnel behind it has been officially declassified. Trait is one of the most vicious works of Eric Lunde, known for 80´s masterpieces under his own name and legendary industrial group Boy Dirt Car. Releases on V2 archief, RRR, AWB, Powertech Industries. "Inspirationals" is carefully reflecting the original tape as accurately as possible. Material is transferred from original master tapes to CD by artist himself, leaving everything 100% as is. There is 2 long pieces (A and B side) with no mastering, no cleaning up, no boosting. Artwork is faithful to the original release, replicating the it as accurate as possible. This is the first release by Industrial Recollections label, aimed for re-issuing sold out pe/industrial/noise releases for fanatical audience. Distributed by Freak Animal Records.

name: Eric Lunde: when you wish upon  scar...
description: The classic "greatest hits" collection selected by Mr. Joe Colley and put out on his Povertech label. Recently unearthed copies by Mr. Colley have landed in our laps and we offer them now for your use and abuse. Contains rare and, up to 1996 when this was released, unreleased material.
